item.title: In Bond Investing, 'Yield' Can Be Calculated in Many Ways
item.description: Investors might be unaware of the various approaches on measuring yield; each gives them one piece of the puzzle.

item.title: How the Chips Act Could Benefit Tech Stocks and Investors
item.description: Semiconductors and other tech stocks have taken a beating. Is it time for a second look?

item.title: Movie Theaters Are Now All About the Coming Attractions
item.description: More big releases in 2023 should help industry close some of the remaining gap from prepandemic levels.

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Swings to Loss, Stung by Battered Market
item.description: The company reported a net loss of $2.69 billion as the value of its overall portfolio fell alongside the broader market.

item.title: Bitcoin-Mining Machines: For Sale on Deep Discount
item.description: Some mining companies’ expenses, especially their debt payments, have overwhelmed their revenue, forcing them to sell hardware to raise cash.

item.title: Deutsche Bank Faces Threat of Fines Over Money-Laundering Controls
item.description: The move by German regulator BaFin suggests it is still unhappy with the bank despite years of pressure.

item.title: Crypto Firms, Executives Step Up Campaign Donations, Lobbying Ahead of Midterms
item.description: The industry is seeking influence in Washington as regulators increase their scrutiny of digital assets.

item.title: Tell Us About Where You Keep Your Savings
item.description: Do you have savings in a bank account, or have you moved money this year to high-yield accounts, savings bonds or other investments?

item.title: HSBC's Top Shareholder Steps Up Pressure for Big Overhaul
item.description: Ping An Insurance says it would support splitting up the banking giant to boost its flagging share price.

item.title: Stocks Finish Higher After Jobs Report
item.description: U.S. stock indexes bounced around before closing higher after a jobs report signaled continued resilience in the labor market.

item.title: Chinese Shares Surge on Covid Reopening Hopes
item.description: The Hang Seng Index closed more than 5% higher after stocks in a variety of sectors saw heavy buying.

item.title: Still Hiring on All Cylinders
item.description: America’s jobs market shows no meaningful sign of slumping despite recession fears and some high-profile anecdotes.

item.title: You Don't Know What You Don't Know About Your Financial Adviser
item.description: The person you turn to for investing advice may have some skeletons in the closet. Finding out about client disputes can be harder than you may think.

item.title: 50 Years Later, Burton Malkiel Hasn't Changed Views on Indexing
item.description: The author of the classic “A Random Walk Down Wall Street” still believes the markets are very hard for any individual to beat.

item.title: AARP-Branded Medicare Drug Plan Is Too Costly for Many Retirees, Critics Say
item.description: The popular plan’s price has risen sharply in recent years—prompting some experts to suggest enrollees consider switching.

item.title: When Is the Best Time of Day to Buy an ETF?
item.description: Research suggests that the conventional wisdom—buy when trading volume is highest—is flawed.

item.title: Check on Your FSA Now, or Be Stuck Buying Sunscreen in December
item.description: Workers who amassed thousands of dollars in their flexible-spending accounts since 2020 risk losing the money if it isn’t spent before Jan. 1.

item.title: Iron-Ore Prices Buckle as China Property-Market Slump Drags On
item.description: Iron-ore prices have slumped to a three-year low as China’s sharp homebuilding slowdown and zero-Covid strategy sap demand for the steelmaking commodity.

item.title: Carvana's Rose-Tinted Windshield Is Dangerous
item.description: The online used-car seller is facing some hazardous market conditions.

item.title: Opendoor Vents the Roof
item.description: The online home-flipping company weathers the housing-market storm, but not without some damage.
